file

Class File

  • java.lang.Object
    • file.File

  • public class File
extends Object
    A class of files, involving a file name, size, a size limit and its writability.
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Tim Lauwers, Tim Robensyn, Robbe Van Biervliet
    Invariants:
  • The name of a file must be valid
        isValidName(getName())
  • The size of a file must be valid
        isValidSize(getSize())
  • The size limit that applies to all bank accounts must be a valid size limit
        isValidSizeLimit(getSizeLimit())
  • The creation time of a file must be valid.
        isValidCreationTime(getCreationTime())
  • The modification time of a file must be valid.
        canHaveAsModificationTime(getModificationTime())

    • Constructor Detail

      • File

        @Raw
public File(String name,
                  long size,
                  boolean writable)
        Initialize a File with a name, size and whether or not it is writable.
        Parameters:
        name - The name for this new file.
        size - The size of this file.
        writable - The initial value for the writability of this new file.
        Precondition:
        The given size must be valid.
            isValidSize(size)
        Postconditions:
      • If the given name is not empty and consists only out of lower and upper case letters, numbers and the following symbols: points (.), hyphens (-) and underscores (_), the initial name of this file is the given name. Otherwise its name is "New_file".
      • If the given size is greater than or equal to zero and lower than the size limit of all files, the initial size of this file is the given number. Otherwise its initial size is 0.
      • The initial writability state of this new file is equal to the given flag.

      • File

        @Raw
public File(String name)
        Initialize this new file with a given name, size 0 and possibility to write.
        Parameters:
        name - The name for this new file.
        Effect:
        This new file is initialized with the given name as its name, 0 as its size and true as is writability state.

    • Method Detail

      • getName

        @Basic
public String getName()

      • setName

        public void setName(String name)
             throws FileNotWritableException
        Set the name of the file as the given string name.
        Parameters:
        name - String that will be used as the filename
        Postcondition:
        If the name is valid, the new name of this file is equal to the given name.
            new.name = name
        Throws:
        FileNotWritableException - This file is not writable and cannot be renamed by the user. | (! this.isWritable())

      • isValidName

        public static boolean isValidName(String name)
        Check whether the given name is valid for a file.
        Parameters:
        name - The name to be checked
        Returns:
        True if and only if the name is not empty and consists only out of lower and upper case letters, numbers and the following symbols: points (.), hyphens (-) and underscores (_)
            result ==
               ( !name.isEmpty()
              && name.matches("^[a-zA-Z0-9.-_]*$") )

      • isValidSize

        public static boolean isValidSize(long size)
        Check whether the given size is valid for a file.
        Parameters:
        size - The size to check.
        Returns:
        True if and only if the size is not below 0 and not above the size limit.
            result ==
               ( (size >= 0)
              && (size <= getSizeLimit()) )

      • getSize

        @Basic
public long getSize()
        Returns the size of this file

      • canAcceptForEnlarge

        public boolean canAcceptForEnlarge(long amount)
        Return a boolean reflecting whether this file can accept the given amount for enlarge.
        Parameters:
        amount - The amount to be checked
        Returns:
        True if and only if the given amount is positive, if there's no overflow and if the size of this file incremented with the given amount is a valid size for any file.
            result ==
               ( (amount > 0)
              && ( getSize() <= Long.MAX_VALUE - amount)
              && ((isValidSize(getSize()+amount)) )

      • enlarge

        public void enlarge(long amount)
        Increase the size of this file with the given size Does nothing if the resulting file size is larger than the size limit
        Parameters:
        amount - The amount with which the file size will be increased.
        Precondition:
        This amount is accepted for enlargement.
            canAcceptForEnlarge(amount)
        Effect:
        The new size of this file is equal to the old size incremented with the give amount of bytes.
            new.getSize() == this.getSize() + amount

      • canAcceptForShorten

        public boolean canAcceptForShorten(long amount)
        Return a boolean reflecting whether this file can accept the given amount for shorten.
        Parameters:
        amount - The amount to be checked.
        Returns:
        True if and only if the given amount is positive and the size of the file decremented with the given amount is a valid size for all files.
            result ==
               ( (amount > 0)
              && ((isValidSize(getSize()-amount)) )

      • shorten

        public void shorten(long amount)
        Decrease the size of this file with the given size Does nothing if the resulting file size is negative
        Parameters:
        amount - The amount with which the file size will be decreased.
        Precondition:
        This amount is accepted to shorten the file.
            canAcceptForShorten(amount)
        Effect:
        The new size of this file is equal to the old size decremented with the given amount of bytes.
            new.getSize() == this.getSize() - amount

      • setSize

        public void setSize(long size)
             throws FileNotWritableException
        Set the size of the file to the given size.
        Parameters:
        size - The size for this file.
        Precondition:
        This amount is a valid size
            isValidSize(size)
        Postcondition:
        The size of the file is set to the given size.
            new.size = size
        Throws:
        FileNotWritableException - This file is not writable and its size cannot be set by the user. | (! this.isWritable())

      • getSizeLimit

        @Basic
 @Immutable
public static long getSizeLimit()

      • setSizeLimit

        public static void setSizeLimit(long limit)
        Set the maximum allowed file size Does nothing if the given limit is negative
        Parameters:
        limit - The new maximum file size for all files.
        Precondition:
        The given limit must be positive and less than or equal to the max value
            limit >= 0
            limit <= Long.MAX_VALUE
        Postcondition:
        The new size limit that applies to all files is equal to the given limit.
            new.getSizeLimit == limit

      • isValidCreationTime

        public boolean isValidCreationTime(Date date)
        Check whether the given date is a valid creation date for this file.
        Parameters:
        date - The date to check.
        Returns:
        True if and only if the date points to the null object or the date is before or at the same time as the current time.
            result =
               ( (date == null)
              || (getCreationTime().before(getCurrentTime()))
              || (getCreationTime().equals(getCurrentTime())) )

      • getCurrentTime

        private static Date getCurrentTime()
        Return the current time

      • getCreationTime

        @Basic
 @Immutable
public Date getCreationTime()
        Return the creation time of the file.

      • canHaveAsModificationTime

        public boolean canHaveAsModificationTime(Date date)
        Check whether the given date is a valid modification date for this file.
        Parameters:
        date - The date to check
        Returns:
        True if and only if date points to the null object or the date is before or at the same time as the current time and after or at the same time as the creation time
            result =
               ( (date == null)
            || ( ( (date.after(getCreationTime()))
                 || (date.equals(getCreationTime())) )
               && ( (date.before(getCurrentTime()))
                 || (date.equals(getCurrentTime())) )) )

      • setModificationTime

        private void setModificationTime()
        Set the time of the last modification of the file.
        Postcondition:
        The time when the file was last modified will be set to the current time.

      • getModificationTime

        @Basic
public Date getModificationTime()
        Returns the modification time of the file.

      • hasOverlappingUsePeriod

        public boolean hasOverlappingUsePeriod(File file)
        Return a boolean reflecting whether a file's use period overlaps with another given file's use period
        Parameters:
        file - The file which use period will be compared with the current file.
        Returns:
        True if and only if both this file as the file to be compared with has a valid modification time and the use period of this file overlaps with the use period of the given file
            result ==
             !( this.getModificationTime().before(file.getCreationTime())
             || this.getCreationTime().after(file.getModificationTime()) )

      • isWritable

        @Basic
public boolean isWritable()

      • setWritable

        public void setWritable(boolean flag)
        Set the writable state of this file according to the given flag.
        Parameters:
        flag - The new writable state of this account
        Postcondition:
        The new writable state of this account is equal to the given flag.
            new.writable = flag
